sidebar.login_to_upload_tooltip: Login to upload firmware and more

guide.title: User Guide
guide.subtitle: LILYGO Spark purpose and quick start
guide.purpose_text: LILYGO Spark is a cross-platform firmware hub and burner for LILYGO and other ESP devices. It lets developers, makers, and enthusiasts easily browse, download, and flash official or community firmware.
guide.purpose_1: Supports ESP32, ESP32-S3, ESP32-C6 and other Espressif chips
guide.purpose_2: One-stop browse and download of LILYGO official and community firmware
guide.purpose_3: Cross-platform on Windows, macOS, Linux with automatic board detection
guide.step1_title: Firmware Center — Choose product and firmware
guide.step1_desc: Select your LILYGO device on the left, browse official or community firmware, download, and flash directly.
guide.step2_desc: Connect your board via USB, select the serial port, choose a .bin firmware file, then click "Start Flashing" to burn.
guide.feature_firmware: Browse and download official or community firmware with product filtering
guide.feature_burner: One-click flash .bin to ESP32/ESP32-S3, serial console supported
guide.feature_dumper: Read and backup firmware from device
guide.feature_utilities: Firmware analyzer, partition editor, serial monitor and more
guide.for_developers_desc: If you need custom firmware sources or your own workflow:
guide.for_developers_1: Firmware manifests pull from GitHub Releases and repo file trees; LILYGO .bin files are hosted in product repos
guide.for_developers_2: In Settings → Advanced, you can specify a local manifest JSON to override the network manifest
guide.open_source_link: Visit GitHub to contribute and share feedback

community.title: LILYGO Related
community.subtitle: Official site, GitHub, Wiki, Taobao, AliExpress, Community

utilities.regulator_desc: Calculate resistor values for adjustable LDOs (e.g. LM317, AMS1117-adj). Vout = Vref × (1 + R2/R1)
utilities.rc_desc: RC charge/discharge time constant and RC filter cutoff. τ = R×C, fc = 1/(2πRC)
utilities.smd_desc_3digit: First 2 digits are significant, 3rd is multiplier. R indicates decimal point (e.g. 4R7=4.7Ω, 472=4.7kΩ).
utilities.smd_desc_4digit: First 3 digits are significant, 4th is multiplier. R for decimal (e.g. 1002=10kΩ).
utilities.smd_desc_eia96: 2-digit code (01-96) + 1 letter (multiplier). Numbers map to E96 values; letters Y=0.01, X=0.1, A=1, B=10, C=100, D=1k, E=10k, F=100k.
utilities.led_resistor_desc: Calculate the resistor needed to drive one or more LEDs in series at a given current.
utilities.led_resistor_hint: Choose a resistor with 2–10× the calculated power rating to avoid overheating.
utilities.led_if_dim_desc: Visible in dark, barely visible in daylight. Many LEDs glow at 0.05mA
utilities.led_if_weak_desc: Noticeably lit but weak. Night indicator, low-power status
utilities.led_if_medium_desc: Clearly visible indoors, not glaring. 5mA ≈70% perceived brightness
utilities.led_if_bright_desc: Obviously bright, default range for most products
utilities.led_if_max_desc: 20mA is the common rated maximum continuous current

settings.title: Settings
settings.link_open_hint: Product pages, GitHub, and news links will open in external browser or in-app window.
settings.glass_hint: Sidebar and settings use frosted glass effect. Turn off on low-end devices for better performance.
settings.sound_hint: Play a chime when firmware flashing completes.
settings.flash_celebration_style_hint: Celebration animation style when flashing completes. Preview in Burner.
settings.firmware_manifest_file_hint: When set, Firmware Center uses this local JSON instead of network. Clear to fetch from network again.
settings.firmware_manifest_active: Using custom manifest. Firmware Center will load from this file.
settings.easter_eggs_konami: Enter Konami code anywhere → "ACCESS GRANTED" overlay
settings.easter_eggs_device_hint: Shows "TARGET ACQUIRED" when ESP32 is detected

dumper.title: Firmware Dumper
dumper.terminal_error_select_device: Error: Please select a device first.
